<section class="video-banner">
    <div id="ytplayer" data-ytid="qxJU4PYuNP0"></div>
    <img src="https://img.youtube.com/vi/qxJU4PYuNP0/maxresdefault.jpg" alt="YouTube video player">
    <button type="button"><span class="visually-hidden">Play</span></button>
</section>
 
<section class="video-banner">
	<div id="ytplayer" data-ytid="qxJU4PYuNP0"></div>
	<img src="https://img.youtube.com/vi/qxJU4PYuNP0/maxresdefault.jpg" alt="{{alt-text}}">
	<button type="button"><span class="visually-hidden">Play</span></button>
</section>
 
{
  "alt-text": "YouTube video player"
}
  • Content: 
    'use strict';

MF.videoBannerYoutube = {
    init: () => {
        // Load the IFrame Player API code asynchronously.
        var tag = document.createElement('script');
        tag.src = 'https://www.youtube.com/player_api';
        var firstScriptTag = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
        firstScriptTag.parentNode.insertBefore(tag, firstScriptTag);

        // YouTube player after the API code downloads.
        var player;

        window.onYouTubePlayerAPIReady = function() {
            var $playerSelector = $('#ytplayer');
            var videoId = $playerSelector.data('ytid');
            var $playButton = $playerSelector.siblings('button');
            var $playPreloader = $playerSelector.siblings('img');

            if ($playerSelector.length) {
                player = new YT.Player('ytplayer', {
                    videoId: videoId,
                    playerVars: {
                        modestbranding: 0,
                        controls: 1,
                        rel: 0
                    },
                    events: {
                        'onReady': function(){
                            $playPreloader.addClass('hidden');
                        },
                        'onStateChange': function(event){
                            $playButton.toggleClass('hidden', event.data === YT.PlayerState.PLAYING);
                        },
                    }
                });
            }

            if ($playButton.length) {
                $playButton.on('click', function(){
                    player.playVideo();
                    $(this).off('click').remove();
                })
            }
        }
    }
};

module.exports = MF.imgBanner;

    .video-banner {
    position: relative;
    height: 0;
    overflow: hidden;
    padding-bottom: 56.25%;

    iframe {
        position: absolute;
        top: 0;
        left: 0;
        width: 100%;
        height: 100%;
    }

    button {
        display: none;
        justify-content: center;
        align-items: center;
        position: absolute;
        top: 50%;
        left: 50%;
        width: px-to-rem(75px);
        height: px-to-rem(75px);
        transform:translateX(-50%) translateY(-50%);
        padding: 0;
        padding-left: px-to-rem(4px);
        font-size: px-to-rem(20px);
        border-radius: 50%;
        color: black;
        background: $white;
        transition: all 0.1s linear;
        opacity: 1;
        z-index: 2;
        pointer-events: all;
        cursor: pointer;

        &::after {
            content: '\25b6';
        }

        &:hover,
        &:focus {
            color: $zuccini;
            width: px-to-rem(80px);
            height: px-to-rem(80px);
        }

        &.hidden {
            opacity: 0;
            pointer-events: none;
        }
    }

    img {
        z-index: 1;
        position: relative;
        width: 100%;
        object-fit: cover;

        &.hidden {
            display: none;
        }
    }
}

.js {
    .video-banner {
        button {
            display: flex;
        }
    }
}

Markup

The youtube ID should be the ID itself, not a url. example: iDafle844;

Accessibility

The custom play button won’t be visible until JS is loaded; The custom play button is removed from DOM once it’s clicked. Removing the play button from the DOM once it’s been pressed and making normal youtube video controls available once the video is playing. We want to make sure users have the ability to toggle the settings they need for the video, including play/pause, toggle captions, etc.
